source_sentence: （一〇六二）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: (1062) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有尊者善生，新剃鬚髮，著袈裟衣，正信非家，出家學道，來詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面。
translation: At the time, a certain Venerable Shangsheng, freshly shaven, wearing the reddish-brown robes, a renunciant of right faith, and a renunciant of the religious path, came to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「諸比丘！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "Monks!

source_sentence: 當知此善生善男子有二處端嚴：一者剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣，正信非家，出家學道。
translation: You should know that this well-arisen good man has two kinds of dignity: First, he shaves off his hair, puts on the reddish-brown robes, becomes a layman of correct faith, leaves home, and trains on the path.

source_sentence: 二者盡諸有漏，無漏心解脫、慧解脫，現法自知作證：『我生已盡，梵行已立，所作已作，自知不受後有。』」
translation: Second, he ends the contaminants, liberates his uncontaminated mind and liberates his wisdom, and knows and realizes for himself the present life, 'My births have been ended, the religious practice has been established, the task has been accomplished, and I know I won't be subject to a later existence.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「寂靜盡諸漏，　　比丘莊嚴好，　離欲斷諸結，　　涅槃不復生。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān spoke a verse, saying, "Quietly ending the contaminants, this monk is adorned and beautiful, free of desire and cutting the bonds, and nirvāṇa doesn't arise again.

source_sentence: 持此最後身，　　摧伏魔怨敵。」
translation: Holding this final body, he destroys Māra's enemies.'"

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一〇六三）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有異比丘形色醜陋，難可觀視，為諸比丘之所輕慢，來詣佛所。
translation: At the time, a certain monk, whose appearance was ugly and difficult to observe, was despised by the monks and came to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊四眾圍遶，見彼比丘來，皆起輕想，更相謂言：「彼何等比丘？
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was surrounded by four people who, when they saw that monk coming, had contempt for him and said to each other, "What kind of monk is that?

source_sentence: 隨路而來，形貌醜陋，難可觀視，為人所慢。」
translation: He comes along the road, has an ugly appearance that's difficult to see, and is regarded with pride by people."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知諸比丘心之所念，告諸比丘：「汝等見彼比丘來，形狀甚醜，難可視見，令人起慢不？」
translation: Knowing what the monks were thinking, the Bhagavān then addressed the monks, "Do you see that monk coming along, whose shape is ugly and difficult to see, and doesn't that cause people to be arrogant?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛：「唯然，已見。」
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, "Yes, I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「汝等勿於彼比丘起於輕想。
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "Don't give that monk a despising thought.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼比丘已盡諸漏，所作已作，離諸重擔，斷諸有結，正智，心善解脫。
translation: That monk has ended the contaminants, done what he did, parted with heavy burdens, cut the bonds of existence, and has right knowledge, and his mind is well liberated.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 汝等莫妄量於人，唯有如來能量於人。」
translation: Don't falsely impute anything to people; only the Tathāgata can measure people."

source_sentence: 彼比丘詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面。
translation: That monk went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告諸比丘：「汝等見此比丘稽首作禮，退坐一面不？」
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān again addressed the monks, "Do you see this monk bowing his head and retreating to sit at one side?"

source_sentence: 比丘白佛：「唯然，已見。」
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, "Yes, I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「汝等勿於是比丘起於輕想；乃至汝等莫量於人，唯有如來能知人耳。」
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "Don't give this monk a light thought; don't even think about people, for only the Tathāgata can know people."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「飛鳥及走獸，　　莫不畏師子，　唯師子獸王，　　無有與等者。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke in verse, "No flying bird or walking animal fears the lion, but the lion king of animals is the only one who has no equal.

source_sentence: 如是智慧人，　　雖小則為大，　莫取其身相，　　而生輕慢心。
translation: Thus, although a man of wisdom is small, he's large; don't take his body shape and become despising.

source_sentence: 何用巨大身，　　多肉而無慧，　此賢勝智慧，　　則為上士夫。
translation: Why use a huge body that's made of flesh but lacks wisdom? This good man is superior to wise men, and he's a superior man.

source_sentence: 離欲斷諸結，　　涅槃永不生，　持此最後身，　　摧伏眾魔軍。」
translation: Free of desire and cutting off the bonds, nirvāṇa never arises, and holding this final body destroys the armies of Māra."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一〇六四）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城迦蘭陀竹園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at the Kalandaka's Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時，提婆達多有利養起，摩竭陀王阿闍世毘提希子日日侍從五百乘車，來詣提婆達多所，日日持五百釜食，供養提婆達多，提婆達多將五百人別眾受其供養。
translation: At the time, Devadatta gave alms, and every day the king of Magadha, Ajātaśatru, accompanied by five hundred chariots, came to Devadatta with five hundred pots of food to offer Devadatta every day, and Devadatta gave offerings to five hundred separate people.

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘晨朝著衣持鉢，入王舍城乞食，聞提婆達多有如是利養起，乃至五百人別眾受其供養。
translation: Many monks then gathered their robes and bowls in the morning and went into Rājagṛha to solicit alms, hearing that Devadatta had thus made offerings, even to the extent that five hundred separate people would accept his offerings.

source_sentence: 乞食已，還精舍，舉衣鉢，洗足畢，往詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After they had begged for alms, they returned to the monastery, put away their robes and bowls, washed their feet, went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等晨朝著衣持鉢，入王舍城乞食，聞提婆達多有如是利養起，乃至五百人別眾受其供養。」
translation: In the early morning, we gathered our robes and bowls and went into Rājagṛha to solicit alms. We heard that Devadatta had raised such a benefit, and even 500 other people accepted his offerings."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「汝等莫稱是提婆達多所得利養。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Don't claim that this is the kind of benefit that Devadatta gets.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼提婆達多別受利養，今則自壞，他世亦壞。
translation: "That Devadatta receives benefits separately, but he destroys himself in the present and in other lives as well.

source_sentence: 譬如芭蕉、竹、蘆，生果即死，來年亦壞；提婆達多亦復如是，受其利養，今世則壞，他世亦壞。
translation: Like a plantain, bamboo, or reed, which dies when it's born and breaks down in the coming year, so too does Devadatta receive benefits from them that break down in the present life and break down in other lives.

source_sentence: 譬如駏驉，受胎必死；提婆達多亦復如是，受諸利養，今世亦壞。
translation: Like the crocodile that's born in the womb and will surely die, so too is Devadatta, who receives the benefits of those things, and it spoils in the present life.

source_sentence: 他世亦壞，彼愚癡提婆達多隨幾時受其利養，當得長夜不饒益苦。
translation: In other lives, it will also perish, and that foolish Devadatta will receive their benefits for a long time and then suffer unbeneficially for a long time.

source_sentence: 是故，諸比丘！
translation: Therefore, monks!

source_sentence: 當如是學：『我設有利養起，莫生染著。』」
translation: Train yourselves in this way: 'Suppose I give rise to something beneficial, so don't become defiledly attached.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「芭蕉生果死，　　竹蘆實亦然，　駏驉坐妊死，　　士以貪自喪。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this verse, "A plantain produces death as fruit, and so does a bamboo or reed.

source_sentence: 常行非義行，　　多知不免愚，　善法日損減，　　莖枯根亦傷。」
translation: Always practicing what's not right, much knowledge doesn't prevent folly, and as the good Dharma declines day by day, their stems wither and their roots are wounded.'"

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一〇六五）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時，舍衛國有手比丘是釋氏子，在舍衛國命終。
translation: At the time, there was a monk named Hand in Śrāvastī who was the son of Śākya and whose life had ended in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘，晨朝著衣持鉢，入舍衛城乞食，聞手比丘釋子於舍衛國命終。
translation: At the time, a large group of monks gathered their robes and bowls in the morning and went into Śrāvastī to solicit alms, but they heard that the hand monk Śākya's son had died in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 聞已，入舍衛城，乞食還，舉衣鉢，洗足畢，詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After hearing this, they went into Śrāvastī, returned from begging for food, put away their robes and bowls, washed their feet, went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今日晨朝，眾多比丘著衣持鉢，入舍衛城乞食，聞釋氏子手比丘於舍衛國命終。
translation: This morning, a large group of monks gathered in the city of Śrāvastī with their robes and bowls to solicit alms, and they heard that the monk Śāriputra had died in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 云何？
translation: What's that?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 手比丘命終，當生何處？
translation: "Where will the handful of monks be born when their lives end?

source_sentence: 云何受生？
translation: How do we receive birth?

source_sentence: 後世云何？」
translation: What will happen in the afterlife?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「是手比丘成就三不善法，彼命終當生惡趣泥犁中。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "If this monk has accomplished three unwholesome qualities, he'll be born in the mire of a bad destiny when his life ends.

source_sentence: 何等三不善法？
translation: What are the three unwholesome qualities?

source_sentence: 謂貪欲、瞋恚、愚癡。
translation: These are desire, anger, and delusion.

source_sentence: 此三不善法結縛於心，釋種子手比丘生惡趣泥犁中。」
translation: These three unwholesome qualities bind the mind, and the monk Śāriputra's hand is born in the mire of a bad destiny."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「貪欲瞋恚癡，　　結縛士夫心，　內發還自傷，　　猶如竹蘆實。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this verse, "Desire, anger, and delusion bind a man's mind, and their internal emission hurts themselves like the fruit of a bamboo reed.

source_sentence: 無貪恚癡心，　　是說為黠慧，　內發不自傷，　　是名為勝出。
translation: A mind lacking craving, ill-will, and delusion is said to be intelligent, and its internal emission isn't self-harming, which is called superior emancipation.

source_sentence: 是故當離貪，　　瞋恚癡冥心，　比丘智慧明，　　苦盡般涅槃。」
translation: Therefore, you must part with greed, anger, ill-will, and delusion, and a monk's wisdom will be clear, and suffering will end and he'll attain parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一〇六六）如手比丘，難陀修多羅亦如是說。
translation: (106) Thus did the monks in hand, and so did Nandasudhara.

source_sentence: （一〇六七）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者難陀是佛姨母子，好著好衣，染色，擣治光澤，執持好鉢，好作嬉戲調笑而行。
translation: At the time, Venerable Nandanavana, the mother and son of the Buddha, was wearing fine clothing, dyeing it, breaking up its shine, carrying a fine bowl, and walking around playfully and laughing.

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘來詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, a large group of monks came to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 尊者難陀是佛姨母子，好著好衣，擣治光澤，執持好鉢，好作嬉戲調笑而行。」
translation: Venerable Nandha is the mother and son of the Buddha's aunt, who wears nice clothes, breaks up his patina, carries a nice bowl, and walks around playfully and jokingly."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告一比丘：「汝往詣難陀比丘所，語言：『難陀！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed a monk, "Go to that monk Nandāna and say, 'Nandāna!

source_sentence: 大師語汝。』」
translation: The Bhagavān has spoken to you.'"

source_sentence: 時，彼比丘受世尊教，往語難陀言：「世尊語汝。」
translation: That monk then, having been instructed by the Bhagavān, went to Nandāna and said, "The Bhagavān says to you."

source_sentence: 難陀聞已，即詣佛所，稽首佛足，退住一面。
translation: After hearing this, Nandha went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 佛告難陀：「汝實好著好衣，擣治光澤，好作嬉戲調笑而行不？」
translation: The Buddha told Nandha, "Do you really wear nice clothes, pounds them to make them shiny, and playfully laugh about them?"

source_sentence: 難陀白佛：「實爾。
translation: Nanda said to the Buddha, "That's true.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告難陀：「汝佛姨母子，貴姓出家，不應著好衣服，擣令光澤，執持好鉢，好作嬉戲調笑而行。
translation: The Buddha told Nandana, "You, the mother and father-in-law of the Buddha, a noble renunciant, shouldn't wear nice clothes, plunder your time to make it shine, carry a nice bowl, and walk around like a playful, jocular person.

source_sentence: 汝應作是念：『我是佛姨母子，貴姓出家，應作阿練若，乞食，著糞掃衣，常應讚歎著糞掃衣，常處山澤，不顧五欲。』」
translation: You should think, 'I am the mother's sister, the noble son of the Buddha, who left home, should become an araṇya, beg for food, wear robes made of rags, and always praise those wearing robes made of rags, always stay in the mountains and swamps, and ignore the five desires.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，難陀受佛教已，修阿蘭若行，乞食，著糞掃衣，亦常讚歎著糞掃衣者，樂處山澤，不顧愛欲。
translation: After accepting Buddhism, Nandika then cultivated the practice of araṇya, begged for food, put on robes made of dung, and always praised those wearing robes made of dung for their happy abiding in the mountains and disregard for the desires of others.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「難陀何見汝，　　修習阿蘭若，　家家行乞食，　　身著糞掃衣，　樂處於山澤，　　不顧於五欲。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke in verse, "What do you see, Nanda, cultivating aranyak, practicing alms at home, wearing robes made of rags, enjoying the mountains and swamps, and not caring about the five desires?"

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，尊者難陀聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, Venerable Nandanavana heard what he taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: （一〇六八）如是我聞：一時，佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者低沙自念，我是世尊姑子兄弟故，不修恭敬，無所顧錄，亦不畏懼，不堪諫止。
translation: At the time, Venerable Daśabala thought to himself, "Because I'm an aunt and brother of the Bhagavān, I don't cultivate respect, don't have any regard, and am not afraid to admonish or stop him.

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘往詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: A large group of monks then went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 尊者低沙自念是世尊姑子兄弟故，不修恭敬，無所顧錄，亦不畏懼，不堪諫止。」
translation: Venerable Daśabala himself thinks that he's an aunt and brother of the Bhagavān, so he doesn't cultivate respect, has no regard for them, and isn't afraid to admonish them."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告一比丘：「汝往詣低沙比丘所，語言：『低沙！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed a monk, "Go to that monk Vaiśravaṇa and say, 'Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 大師語汝！』」
translation: Great Teacher, I say to you!"

source_sentence: 時，彼比丘受世尊教，往語低沙比丘言：「世尊語汝！」
translation: That monk then, having been instructed by the Bhagavān, went over to the monk Dīpaṃsaka and said, "The Bhagavān says to you!"

source_sentence: 低沙比丘即詣佛所，稽首佛足，退住一面。
translation: The monk Vaiśravaṇa went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 佛告低沙：「汝實作是念：『我是世尊姑子兄弟，不修恭敬，無所顧錄，亦不畏懼，不堪忍諫。』
translation: The Buddha told Vaiśravaṇa, "Do you really think, 'I'm an aunt and brother of the Bhagavān who doesn't cultivate respect, doesn't have any regard, isn't afraid, and can't stand admonition.' No?"
No?"

source_sentence: 低沙白佛：「實爾。
translation: Vaiśravaṇa said to the Buddha, "It's true.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告低沙：「汝不應爾！
translation: The Buddha told Vaiśravaṇa, "You shouldn't do that!

source_sentence: 汝應念言：『我是世尊姑子兄弟故，應修恭敬畏懼，堪忍諫止。』」
translation: You should think and say, 'Because I'm the Bhagavān's aunt and brother, I should cultivate respect and fear, and I can tolerate admonition.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「善哉汝低沙，　　離瞋恚為善，　莫生瞋恚心，　　瞋恚者非善。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān spoke in verse, saying, "Good, you lowly beings, for it's good to be free of anger; don't become angry, for anger is not good.

source_sentence: 若能離瞋慢，　　修行軟下心，　然後於我所，　　修行於梵行。」
translation: If you can be free of anger and conceit, cultivate a gentle and lowly mind, and then cultivate the religious practice in my place.'"

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，低沙比丘聞佛所說，歡喜隨喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, the monks of Vaiśravaṇa who heard what he taught rejoiced and followed him, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: （一〇六九）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有尊者毘舍佉般闍梨子，集供養堂，為眾多比丘說法，言辭滿足，妙音清徹，句味辯正，隨智慧說，聽者樂聞，無所依說，顯現深義，令諸比丘一心專聽。
translation: At the time, there was the Venerable Vaiśākha Prajāriputra who gathered in the offering hall and preached to a large group of monks, fulfilling his words with a wonderfully clear voice and a discerning flavor, speaking with wisdom as he pleased, allowing listeners to hear and revealing the profound meaning of the teaching without relying on it, and causing the monks to concentrate their minds and listen intently.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊入晝正受，以淨天耳過於人耳，聞說法聲，從三昧起，往詣講堂，於大眾前坐，告毘舍佉般闍梨子：「善哉！
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān entered into the pārijāta proper and, having purified the divine ear more than the human ear, heard the sound of the teaching, rose from his samādhi, went to the discussion hall, sat down in front of the crowd, and told Vaiśākha-rāja, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 毘舍佉！
translation: Vaiśākha!

source_sentence: 汝能為諸比丘於此供養堂，為眾多比丘說法，言辭滿足，乃至顯現深義，令諸比丘專精敬重，一心樂聽，汝當數數為諸比丘如是說法，令諸比丘專精敬重，一心樂聽，當得長夜以義饒益，安隱樂住。」
translation: If you can speak for the monks in this offering hall and explain the teaching to a large number of monks in words that fulfill and reveal its profound meaning, so that the monks will concentrate their respect and listen with joy, you will repeatedly explain the teaching to the monks in such a way that the monks will concentrate their respect and listen with joy, and they will attain a long night of benefitting others with meaning and living in well-being."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「若不說法者，　　愚智雜難分，　此愚此智慧，　　無由自顯現，　善說清涼法，　　因說智乃彰，　說法為明照，　　光顯大仙幢，　善說為仙幢，　　法為羅漢幢。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the verse, "If someone doesn't teach the Dharma, foolish wisdom is mixed up and difficult to discern; this foolishness and this wisdom have no way to reveal themselves; the Dharma is well explained as a clear and cool dharma; knowledge is made clear by explanation; the Dharma is explained as a bright illumination; the light reveals the banner of great sages; it's well explained as the banner of sages; and the Dharma is the banner of arhats."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，尊者毘舍佉般闍梨子聞佛所說，歡喜隨喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, Venerable Vaiśākha Prajāpāramitā heard what he taught, rejoiced and followed him, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: （一〇七〇）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: (1070) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘集供養堂，悉共作衣。
translation: At the time, a large group of monks had gathered in the offering hall, and they were all making robes together.

source_sentence: 時，有一年少比丘！
translation: Then, there was a year-old monk!

source_sentence: 出家未久，初入法、律，不欲營助諸比丘作衣。
translation: They hadn't left home long before they first entered the Dharma and Vinaya, and they didn't want to help the monks make robes.

source_sentence: 時，眾多比丘詣世尊所，稽首禮足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: A large group of monks then went to the Bhagavān, bowed their heads at their feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘集供養堂，為作衣故。
translation: At the time, there were many monks who had gathered in the offering hall for the purpose of making robes.

source_sentence: 有一年少比丘，出家未久，始入法、律，不欲營助諸比丘作衣。」
translation: There was a young monk a year old who had left home not long before he entered the Dharma and vinaya and didn't want to help the monks make robes."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊問彼比丘：「汝實不欲營助諸比丘作衣耶？」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān asked that monk, "Is it true that you don't want to help the monks make robes?"

source_sentence: 彼比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: That monk said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 隨我所能，當力營助。」
translation: As much as I can, I'll help."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼比丘心之所念，告諸比丘：「汝等莫與是年少比丘語。
translation: Knowing what those monks were thinking, the Bhagavān then addressed the monks, "Don't talk to that young monk.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是比丘得四增心法，正受現法安樂住，不勤而得。
translation: "This monk has attained four factors that increase his mind and are correctly experienced as abiding comfortably in the present life, which he attains without effort.

source_sentence: 若彼本心所為，剃鬚髮，著袈裟衣，出家學道，增進修學，現法自知作證：『我生已盡，梵行已立，所作已作，自知不受後有。』」
translation: If he shaved his hair, put on the reddish-brown robes, left home to train on the path, and intensified his training, he knows and testifies to the present reality: 'My births have been ended, the religious practice has been established, the task has been accomplished, and I know I won't be subject to a later existence.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「非下劣方便，　　薄德少智慧，　正向於涅槃，　　免脫煩惱鏁。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān spoke a verse, saying, "Not a person of inferior skill, with little virtue and little wisdom, who's correctly headed for nirvāṇa, is freed from the torment of retribution.

source_sentence: 此賢年少者，　　逮得上士處，　離欲心解脫，　　涅槃不復生。
translation: This good young man has attained the stage of a superior man, freed his mind from desire and liberated it, and nirvāṇa won't arise again.

source_sentence: 持此最後身，　　摧伏眾魔軍。」
translation: Holding this final body, he destroys the armies of Māra."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一〇七一）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有比丘名曰上坐，獨住一處，亦常讚歎獨一住者，獨行乞食，食已，獨還，獨坐禪思。
translation: At the time, there was a monk named Shangzhai who lived alone in one place, always praised those who lived alone, went alone to solicit alms, and after he ate, returned alone to sit alone in meditation.

source_sentence: 時，有眾多比丘詣佛所，稽首佛足，退坐一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: A large group of monks then went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有尊者名曰上坐，樂一獨處，亦常讚歎獨一住者，獨入聚落乞食，獨出聚落，還至住處，獨坐禪思。」
translation: There's a venerable man named Uttarakuru who enjoys solitude and always praises those who live alone, go into a village alone to solicit alms, leave the village alone, return to their dwelling, and sit alone in meditation."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊語一比丘：「汝往詣彼上坐比丘所，語上坐比丘言：『大師告汝！』」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān said to one of the monks, "Go to that superior sitting monk and tell that superior sitting monk, 'Great teacher, I'm telling you!'"

source_sentence: 比丘受教，詣上坐比丘所，白言：「尊者！
translation: Accepting the teaching, the monk went up to the sitting monk and said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 大師告汝！」
translation: Great Teacher, I tell you!"

source_sentence: 時，上坐比丘即時奉命，詣世尊所，稽首禮足，退住一面。
translation: Upon being instructed, the superior sitting monk went to the Bhagavān, paid homage by prostrating himself, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告上坐比丘：「汝實獨一靜處，讚歎獨處者，獨行乞食，獨出聚落，獨坐禪思耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the superior monk, "Are you really alone in a quiet place, praising someone who lives alone, goes begging for food alone, goes out to a village alone, and sits alone in meditation?"

source_sentence: 上坐比丘白佛：「實爾，世尊！」
translation: The superior sitting monk said to the Buddha, "Indeed, Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告上坐比丘：「汝云何獨一處，讚歎獨住者，獨行乞食，獨還住處，獨坐禪思？」
translation: The Buddha addressed the monk sitting upstairs, "How do you go to a place alone, praise someone who lives alone, go begging for food alone, return to your dwelling alone, and sit alone in meditation?"

source_sentence: 上坐比丘白佛：「我唯獨一靜處，讚歎獨住者，獨行乞食，獨出聚落，獨坐禪思。」
translation: The superior sitting monk said to the Buddha, "I only have one quiet place, and I praise those who live alone, go alone to solicit alms, go alone from the village, and sit alone in meditation."

source_sentence: 佛告上坐比丘：「汝是一住者，我不言非一住，然更有勝妙一住。
translation: The Buddha told the superior sitting monk, "You're a monastic, but I wouldn't say it's not a monastic, yet there's another surpassing and wonderful monastic.

source_sentence: 何等為勝妙一住？
translation: What's the surpassing and marvelous single abode?

source_sentence: 謂比丘前者枯乾，後者滅盡，中無貪喜，是婆羅門心不猶豫，已捨憂悔，離諸有愛，群聚使斷，是名一住，無有勝住過於此者！」
translation: A monk whose former is dried up and whose latter is extinguished and in whom there is no craving or enjoyment is a Brāhmaṇa who doesn't hesitate, who abandons sorrow and regret, who parts with craving, and who stops the tendency to clump together is called a monk who stands alone, and there's no superior abode to this!"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「悉映於一切，　　悉知諸世間，　不著一切法，　　悉離一切愛，　如是樂住者，　　我說為一住。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the verse, "He reflects them all, knows them all, doesn't cling to all things, is free of all cravings, and thus abides happily, which I've described as a single abode."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，尊者上坐聞佛所說，歡喜隨喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, the venerable ascended to his seat and heard what he taught, rejoiced and followed him, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: （一〇七二）如是我聞：一時，佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時，有尊者僧迦藍於拘薩羅人間遊行，至舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: At the time, a prized monk named Saṃghârāma traveled among the people of Kośala and went to Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 彼僧迦藍比丘有本二，在舍衛國中，聞僧迦藍比丘於拘薩羅人間遊行，至舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: That monk Saṃghârāma, of original two origin, was in Śrāvastī and heard that the monk Saṃghârāma had marched among the people of Kośala to the Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 聞已，著好衣服，莊嚴華瓔，抱其兒來詣祇洹，至僧迦藍比丘房前。
translation: After hearing that, he was dressed in fine clothes, adorned with flowers and diadem, carried his son to Gipan, and went to the monk Saṃghârāma's room.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者僧迦藍出房露地經行。
translation: At the time, Venerable Saṃghârāma left his room to walk on the open ground.

source_sentence: 時，彼本二來到其前，作是言：「此兒幼小，汝捨出家，誰當養活？」
translation: When the original two came to him, they said, "Who will support this young child, since he's so young and you left home?"

source_sentence: 時，僧迦藍比丘不共語。
translation: The monk Saṃghârāma then didn't speak in common.

source_sentence: 如是再三，亦不共語。
translation: He did so three more times, but he didn't speak with them either.

source_sentence: 時，彼本二作如是言：「我再三告，不與我語，不見顧視，我今置兒。」
translation: The original two then said, "I've told them three times not to speak to me and not to look at them, so now I'll put my child away."

source_sentence: 著經行道頭而去，言：「沙門！
translation: Putting his head on the path of sūtra walking, he departed, saying, "Monks!

source_sentence: 此是汝子，汝自養活，我今捨去。」
translation: This is your son; take care of him yourself; I'll let him go now."

source_sentence: 尊者僧迦藍亦不顧視其子。
translation: Venerable Saṃghârāma also didn't look after his son.

source_sentence: 彼本二復言：「是沙門今於此兒都不顧視，彼必得仙人難得之處。
translation: The original two also said, "Now, this ascetic doesn't even look after his son, for he will surely attain a place that's difficult for an immortal to attain.

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Good!

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: śramaṇa!

source_sentence: 必得解脫。」
translation: I'm sure I'll be liberated."

source_sentence: 情願不遂，抱子而去。
translation: When his wish was not fulfilled, he embraced his son and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊入晝正受，以天耳過人之耳，聞尊者僧迦藍本二所說，即說偈言：「來者不歡喜，　　去亦不憂慼。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān entered the pārijāta and was properly ordained, and with the divine ear surpassing the human ear, he heard what Venerable Saṃghârāma had said in the past two years and spoke in verse, saying, "Those who come will not rejoice, and those who depart will not be sad.

source_sentence: 於世間和合，　　解脫不染著。
translation: They are united in the worldly harmony, liberated, and undefiled.

source_sentence: 我說彼比丘，　　為真婆羅門。
translation: I say that monk is a true brāhmaṇa.

source_sentence: 來者不歡喜，　　去亦不憂慼。
translation: He's not joyous when he comes, and he's not sad when he goes.

source_sentence: 不染亦無憂，　　二心俱寂靜，　我說是比丘，　　是真婆羅門。」
translation: Not defiled or sad, both minds are quiescent, and I say this monk is a true brāhmaṇa."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，尊者僧迦藍聞佛所說，歡喜隨喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, the Venerable Saṃghârāma heard what he taught, rejoiced and followed him, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: （一〇七三）如是我聞：一時，佛住舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者阿難獨一靜處，作是思惟：「有三種香，順風而熏，不能逆風。
translation: At the time, the Venerable Ānanda was alone in a quiet place, thinking, "There are three kinds of fragrance that are perfumed by following the breeze but can't be turned against it.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 謂根香、莖香、華香。
translation: It's called root fragrance, stem fragrance, and flower fragrance.

source_sentence: 或復有香，順風熏，亦逆風熏，亦順風逆風熏耶？」
translation: Or is there another fragrance that's perfumed by a breeze that goes along with it, a breeze that goes against it, or a breeze that goes against it?"

source_sentence: 作是念已，晡時從禪覺，往詣佛所，稽首佛足，退住一面，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After this thought, he left Meditation and Enlightenment in the afternoon, went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我獨一靜處，作是思惟：『有三種香，順風而熏，不能逆風。
translation: Alone in a quiet place, I thought, 'There are three kinds of fragrance that are perfumed by following the breeze but can't be turned against it.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 謂根香、莖香、華香。
translation: It's called root fragrance, stem fragrance, and flower fragrance.

source_sentence: 或復有香，順風熏、逆風熏，亦順風逆風熏耶？』」
translation: Or is there another fragrance that's perfumed by a breeze, that's perfumed by a breeze, or that's perfumed by a breeze and a breeze?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「如是！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 有三種香，順風熏，不能逆風，謂根香、莖香、華香。
translation: There are three kinds of fragrance that are perfumed by following the wind and can't be turned against it: root fragrance, stem fragrance, and flower fragrance.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 亦有香，順風熏、逆風熏、順風逆風熏。
translation: "There's also fragrance that smells like wind, breeze, and breeze.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 順風熏、逆風熏、順風逆風熏者。
translation: "It's perfumed by the wind, perfumed by the wind, and perfumed by the wind and wind.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 有善男子、善女人，在所城邑、聚落，成就真實法，盡形壽不殺生、不偷盜、不邪婬、不妄語、不飲酒。
translation: "There are good men and good women in their towns and villages who achieve the true dharma and spend their whole lives not killing, not stealing, not committing sexual misconduct, not speaking falsehoods, and not drinking alcohol.

source_sentence: 如是善男子、善女人，八方上下，崇善士夫，無不稱歎言：『某方某聚落善男子、善女人，持戒清淨，成真實法，盡形壽不殺，乃至不飲酒。』
translation: Thus, there are good men and good women in eight directions and up and down, respected by good men and women who praise them, saying, 'That good man or good woman in a certain village in a certain direction observes precepts and is pure, has accomplished the true teaching, and doesn't kill for the rest of his or her life, even if he or she doesn't drink alcohol.'

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是名有香順風熏、逆風熏、順風逆風熏。」
translation: This is called having an odor that smells like perfuming with the wind, perfuming against the wind, and perfuming with the wind and against the wind."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「非根莖華香，　　能逆風而熏，　唯有善士女，　　持戒清淨香。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke the verse, "It's not the fragrance of flowers with rhizome that can be perfumed against the wind, but only the fragrance of a good woman who upholds the precepts and is pure.

source_sentence: 逆順滿諸方，　　無不普聞知，　多迦羅栴檀，　　優鉢羅末利。
translation: Adversity and concomitance pervade all directions, and none are universally heard, Tākara-candana, or Upamālī.

source_sentence: 如是比諸香，　　戒香最為上，　栴檀等諸香，　　所熏少分限。
translation: Of all these fragrances, the fragrance of precepts is the greatest, and there's only a small amount of fragrance such as sandalwood that's perfumed.

source_sentence: 唯有戒德香，　　流熏上昇天，　斯等淨戒香，　　不放逸正受。
translation: Only the scent of the virtue of morality, which perfumes the highest heaven, is the scent of these pure precepts, which are not received with dissipation.

source_sentence: 正智等解脫，　　魔道莫能入，　是名安隱道，　　是道則清淨。
translation: With right knowledge and right liberation, no demon can enter what's called the peaceful path, and this path is pure.

source_sentence: 正向妙禪定，　　斷諸魔結縛。」
translation: Correctly heading toward marvelous meditation, they sever the bonds of Māra."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，尊者阿難聞佛所說，歡喜隨喜，作禮而去。
translation: After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, Venerable Ānanda heard what he taught, rejoiced and followed him, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: （一〇七四）如是我聞：一時，佛在摩竭提國人間遊行。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in a procession among the people of the country of Magadha.

source_sentence: 與千比丘俱，皆是古昔縈髮出家，皆得阿羅漢，諸漏已盡，所作已作，捨諸重擔，逮得己利，盡諸有結，正智，善解脫，到善建立支提杖林中住。
translation: He was accompanied by a thousand monks, all of whom had left home with their hair shaved, had attained arhatship, had ended the contaminants, had accomplished what they had done, had abandoned their heavy burdens, had acquired their own benefits, had ended the bonds of existence, had right knowledge, had good liberation, and had gone to live in the forest of the well-established caitya.

source_sentence: 摩竭提王瓶沙聞世尊摩竭提國人間遊行，至善建立支提杖林中住，與諸小王群臣羽從，車萬二千、乘馬萬八千、步逐眾無數，摩竭提婆羅門長者悉皆從。
translation: The king of Magadha, Vibhāṣā, heard that the Bhagavān had taken a procession through the people of Magadha and gone to live in the well-established caitya forest with a small army of ministers and chariots numbering 22,000, horses numbering 8,000, and foot soldiers numbering incalculable, and the elders of the Magadha brāhmaṇas were all with him.

source_sentence: 王出王舍城，詣世尊所，恭敬供養。

source_sentence: 周向十方，種種現化已，即於空中，內身出火，還自焚其身，取無餘涅槃，消盡寂滅，令無遺塵。
translation: After these various manifestations have taken place in the ten directions, he then emits fire from his inner body in the sky and burns his own body, taking nirvāṇa without remainder, completely extinguishing it, and leaving no dust behind.

source_sentence: 譬如空中然燈，油炷俱盡，陀驃摩羅子空中涅槃，身心俱盡，亦復如是。
translation: Like a lamp in the sky that burns out all its oil, so too does the dravya-mālāja nirvāṇa in the sky burn out his body and mind.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「譬如燒鐵丸，　　其焰洞熾然，　熱勢漸息滅，　　莫知其所歸。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this verse, "It's like a ball of iron that's burning, its flame blazing brightly, its heat gradually going out, and no one knows where it's going.

source_sentence: 如是等解脫，　　度煩惱淤泥，　諸流永已斷，　　莫知其所之。
translation: Thus liberated, they escape the mire of affliction, their currents are permanently stopped, and they don't know where they're going.

source_sentence: 逮得不動跡，　　入無餘涅槃。」
translation: They've attained immovable traces and entered nirvāṇa without remainder."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一〇七七）如是我聞：一時，佛在央瞿多羅國人間遊行。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was traveling among the people of the country of Yogurtārā.

source_sentence: 經陀婆闍梨迦林中，見有牧牛者、牧羊者、採柴草者，及餘種種作人，見世尊行路，見已，皆白佛言：「世尊！
translation: As he passed through the Dhavajālika forest, he saw cattle herders, sheep herders, firewood gatherers, and other kinds of people who were engaged in various occupations and who saw the Bhagavān walking along the road, they all said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 莫從此道去！
translation: Don't go through this path!

source_sentence: 前有央瞿利摩羅賊，脫恐怖人。」
translation: In the past, there was the bandit Yogâcāra Mālava, a man who was free from fear."

source_sentence: 佛告諸人：「我不畏懼！」
translation: The Buddha told the crowd, "I'm not afraid!"

source_sentence: 作此語已，從道而去。
translation: After making this statement, he left on the path.

source_sentence: 彼再三告，世尊猶去。
translation: He repeatedly told them, but the Bhagavān continued to depart.

source_sentence: 遙見央瞿利摩羅手執刀楯走向，世尊以神力現身徐行，令央瞿利摩羅駃走不及。
translation: Seeing Yogâcāra walking with his sword and shield in his hand, the Bhagavān showed up in person and walked slowly, causing Yogâcāra to run too fast for him.

source_sentence: 走極疲乏已，遙語世尊：「住！
translation: When he was extremely weary from walking, he said to the Bhagavān from a distance, "Stop!

source_sentence: 住！
translation: Stay!

source_sentence: 勿去！」
translation: Don't go!"

source_sentence: 世尊竝行而答：「我常住耳，汝自不住！」
translation: The Bhagavān replied, "I am always present, but you are not!"

source_sentence: 爾時，央瞿利摩羅即說偈言：「沙門尚駃行，　　而言我常住，　我今疲勌住，　　說言汝不住，　沙門說云何，　　我住汝不住？」
translation: It was then that Yogâcāra addressed the monk in verse, "The ascetic is still fastidious in his ways and says, 'I always abide,' and now I'm weary of abiding, saying, 'You don't abide,' and what does the ascetic say, 'You don't abide when I abide?'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以偈答言：「央瞿利摩羅，　　我說常住者，　於一切眾生，　　謂息於刀杖。
translation: The Bhagavān then answered in a verse, "Yogâculimālīya, I say that he who is eternally abiding is the one who calms the knife and bludgeon for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 汝恐怖眾生，　　惡業不休息，　我於一切蟲，　　止息於刀杖。
translation: You fear sentient beings and don't rest from bad actions, and I stop all worms at the point of a sword and bludgeon.

source_sentence: 汝於一切蟲，　　常逼迫恐怖，　造作凶惡業，　　終無休息時。
translation: You are always terrorized by all worms, and you create bad and evil actions that never come to rest.

source_sentence: 我於一切神，　　止息於刀杖，　汝於一切神，　　長夜苦逼迫。
translation: I stop at the sword and stick for all the gods, and you are persecuted by all the gods long into the night.

source_sentence: 造作黑惡業，　　于今不止息，　我住於息法，　　一切不放逸。
translation: You create bad karma that doesn't stop now, but I abide in the resting dharma and don't let go of anything.

source_sentence: 汝不見四諦，　　故不息放逸。」
translation: You don't see the four noble truths, so you don't rest and relax."

source_sentence: 央瞿利摩羅說偈白佛：「久乃見牟尼，　　故隨路而逐，　今聞真妙說，　　當捨久遠惡。
translation: Aṇgulimālīya said in a verse to the Buddha, "After seeing Muni for a long time, I followed the road and chased after him. Now that I've heard the true and wonderful teaching, I'll abandon the long-standing evil.

source_sentence: 作如是說已，　　即放捨刀楯，　投身世尊足，　　願聽我出家。
translation: After he said this, he then let go of his sword and shield, threw himself at the feet of the Bhagavān, and asked to be allowed to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛以慈悲心，　　大僊多哀愍，　告比丘善來，　　出家受具足。」
translation: With a compassionate heart and great immortality and kindness, the Buddha told that monk Shanlai to leave home and accept the full monastic career."

source_sentence: 爾時，央瞿利摩羅出家已，獨一靜處，專精思惟：「所以族姓子剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣，正信非家，出家學道，增修梵行，現法自知作證：『我生已盡，梵行已立，所作已作，自知不受後有。』」
translation: After leaving home, Yogâcārabhūmi was alone in a quiet place, concentrating his thoughts, "So that clansman shaved off his hair, put on the reddish-brown robes, correctly believed that he wasn't home, left home to train on the path, increased his religious practice, and realized for himself in the present life, 'My births have been ended, the religious practice has been established, the task has been accomplished, and I know I won't be subject to a later existence.'"

source_sentence: 時，央瞿利摩羅得阿羅漢，覺解脫喜樂。
translation: At the time, Yogâcāra Mālava became an arhat and felt joyous with liberation.

source_sentence: 即說偈言：「本受不害名，　　而中多殺害，　今得見諦名，　　永離於傷殺。
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, "He was once called harmless but often killed, but now he's attained the name of Truth and is free of killing and wounding forever.

source_sentence: 身行不殺害，　　口意俱亦然，　當知真不殺，　　不迫於眾生。
translation: Not killing in bodily actions and likewise in speech and thought, you should know that true nonkill doesn't constrain sentient beings.

source_sentence: 洗手常血色，　　名央瞿摩羅，　浚流之所漂，　　三歸制令息。
translation: Washing his hands, which are always bloody, is called yanggomara, which dredges up the current and restrains it three times.

source_sentence: 歸依三寶已，　　出家得具足，　成就於三明，　　佛教作已作。
translation: After taking refuge in the Three Treasures, he leaves home and becomes fully ordained, accomplishes the three kinds of knowledge, and carries out the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 調牛以捶杖，　　伏象以鐵鈎，　不以刀捶杖，　　正度調天人。
translation: Regulating an ox with a stick, subduing an elephant with an iron hook, and not using a sword or stick, he correctly liberates celestials and humans.

source_sentence: 利刀以水石，　　直箭以熅火，　治材以斧斤，　　自調以黠慧。
translation: He uses water and stone for a sharp sword, fire for a straight arrow, an axe for healing lumber, and wisdom for self-adjustment.

source_sentence: 人前行放逸，　　隨後能自斂，　是則照世間，　　如雲解月現。
translation: A person's previous careless actions are followed by their ability to control themselves, which then illuminates the world like clouds unraveling the moon's appearance.

source_sentence: 人前放逸行，　　隨後能自斂，　於世恩愛流，　　正念而超出。
translation: A person who acts carelessly beforehand and then manages to control himself afterward is correctly mindful and transcends the flow of worldly kindness.

source_sentence: 少壯年出家，　　精勤修佛教，　是則照世間，　　如雲解月現。
translation: When they leave home as a young man and are vigorously cultivating Buddhism, this illuminates the world like a cloud understanding the moon's appearance.

source_sentence: 少壯年出家，　　精勤修佛教，　於世恩愛流，　　正念以超出。
translation: They leave home as young adults, diligently cultivate Buddhism, and correctly think beyond the flow of worldly kindnesses and loves.

source_sentence: 若度諸惡業，　　正善能令滅，　是則照世間，　　如雲解月現。
translation: If he counteracts bad actions and causes right goodness to cease, then he illuminates the world like a cloud that interprets the moon's appearance.

source_sentence: 人前造惡業，　　正善能令滅，　於世恩愛流，　　正念能超出。
translation: When people previously created bad actions, right goodness caused them to cease, and right mindfulness overcame the flow of worldly kindness.

source_sentence: 我已作惡業，　　必向於惡趣，　已受於惡報，　　宿責食已食。
translation: After I do bad actions, I'll surely go to a bad destiny, and after I've received the results of bad actions, I'll eat the food that I was condemned to eat in the past.

source_sentence: 若彼我怨憎，　　聞此正法者，　得清淨法眼，　　於我修行忍。
translation: If someone I hate hears this right teaching, they'll attain the pure eye of the Dharma and cultivate patience with me.

source_sentence: 不復興鬪訟，　　蒙佛恩力故，　我怨行忍辱，　　亦常讚歎忍。
translation: They won't get into another fight, and because of the Buddha's grace, they'll practice forbearance toward my enemy and always praise forbearance.

source_sentence: 隨時聞正法，　　聞已隨修行。」
translation: He hears the right teaching at appropriate times and then cultivates it after hearing it."

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，央瞿利摩羅聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, Yogâcāra rejoiced and handed it down after hearing what he taught.

source_sentence: （一〇七八）如是我聞：一時，佛住王舍城迦蘭陀竹園。
translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Kalandaka's Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時，有異比丘，於夜明相出時，出搨補河邊，脫衣著岸邊，入水洗浴。
translation: At the time, a certain monk, when he emerged at night at dawn, went out to live by a river, took off his robes, put them on the bank, and plunged into the water to wash himself.

source_sentence: 浴已上岸，被一衣，待身乾。
translation: After he had bathed, he went ashore, put on a robe, and waited until his body was dry.

source_sentence: 時，有一天子放身光明，普照搨補河側，語比丘言：「汝少出家，鮮白髮黑，年始盛美，應習五欲，莊嚴瓔珞，塗香華鬘，五樂自娛，而於是時，違親背俗，悲泣別離，剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣，正信非家，出家學道。
translation: At the time, a celestial being radiated his body in a bright light that shone universally over the side of the river Zhejiang, and said to the monk, "You were a young renunciant, fresh white and black-haired, in the prime of life, and should have been cultivating the five desires, adorning jewelry, coating yourself with incense and flowers, and enjoying the five pleasures for yourself.

source_sentence: 如何捨現前樂，而求非時之利？」
translation: How could they abandon their present pleasures and seek benefits at a time when they weren't?"

source_sentence: 比丘答言：「我不捨現前樂求非時樂，我今乃是捨非時樂得現前樂。」
translation: The monk replied, "I don't abandon present pleasure and seek non-temporary pleasure, but now I've abandoned non-temporary pleasure to attain present pleasure."

source_sentence: 天問比丘：「云何捨非時樂得現前樂？」
translation: The gods asked the monk, "How do you abandon non-periodic pleasures to attain present pleasures?"

source_sentence: 比丘答言：「如世尊說，非時之欲，少味多苦，少利多難。
translation: The monk replied, "Just as the Bhagavān said, desire at an inopportune time is less tasty and more painful, and it's less beneficial and more difficult.

source_sentence: 我今於現法中，已離熾然，不待時節，能自通達，現前觀察，緣自知覺。
translation: Now, in the present life, I've parted with feverishness, don't wait for the right time, can comprehend it on my own, examine it beforehand, and know it for myself.

source_sentence: 如是，天子！
translation: Thus, my lord!

source_sentence: 是名捨非時樂得現前樂。」
translation: This is called abandoning non-timely pleasures to attain present pleasures."

source_sentence: 天復問比丘：「云何復是如來所說，非時之欲，少樂多苦？
translation: Again, the gods asked the monks, "How is it that the Tathāgata teaches that desire out of time is less pleasant and more painful?

source_sentence: 云何復是如來所說，現法利樂，乃至緣自覺知？」
translation: How else does the Tathāgata explain the benefits and pleasures of the present life, up to the point of self-realization?"

source_sentence: 比丘答言：「我年少出家，不能廣宣如來所說正法、律儀。
translation: The monk replied, "I was a young renunciant, and I'm not able to teach the correct Dharma and precepts taught by the Tathāgata in detail.

source_sentence: 世尊近在迦蘭陀竹園。
translation: The Bhagavān is recently at the Kalandaka's Bamboo Park.

source_sentence: 汝可往詣如來，問其所疑，如世尊說，隨憶受持。」
translation: You can go to the Tathāgata, ask about your doubts, and memorize and uphold them as the Bhagavān explains them."

source_sentence: 天子復言：「比丘！
translation: The prince then replied, "Monks!

source_sentence: 於如來所，有諸力天眾多圍遶，我先無問，未易可詣。
translation: At the Tathāgata's residence, there are many powerful gods surrounding him, and I didn't ask questions before, so it's not easy to get there.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 汝若能為先白世尊者，我可隨往。」
translation: If you can first tell the Bhagavān about this, I can go along with you."

source_sentence: 比丘答言：「當為汝去！」
translation: The monk replied, "I'll go for you!"

source_sentence: 天白比丘：「唯然，尊者！
translation: The gods said to the monks, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我隨後來。」
translation: I'll come after you."

source_sentence: 時，彼比丘往詣佛所，稽首禮足，退住一面，以向天子往反問答具白世尊：「今者，世尊！
translation: The monk then went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and answered the questions of the gods in return, saying, "Now, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼天子誠實言者須臾應至，不誠實者自當不來。」
translation: That prince will arrive in a moment if he's sincere in what he says, and he won't come if he's not sincere."

source_sentence: 時，彼天子遙語比丘：「我已在此，我已在此。」
translation: The celestial then spoke to the monks from a distance, "I've been here, and I've been here."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即說偈言：「眾生隨愛想，　　以愛想而住，　以不知愛故，　　則為死方便。」
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān spoke a verse, saying, "Beings follow conceptions of craving, abide with conceptions of craving, and because they don't know about craving, it's a convenient way to die."

source_sentence: 佛告天子：「汝解此偈者，便可發問。」
translation: The Buddha told the celestial, "If you understand this verse, then you can ask questions."

source_sentence: 天子白佛：「不解，世尊！
translation: The prince said to the Buddha, "I don't understand it, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不解，善逝！」
translation: I don't understand, good riddance!"

source_sentence: 佛復說偈而告天子曰：「若知所愛者，　　不於彼生愛，　彼此無所有，　　他人莫能說。」
translation: Again, the Buddha spoke a verse and told the celestial, "If someone knows what they love and doesn't get attached to it, they don't have anything in common, and no one else can tell them."

source_sentence: 佛告天子：「汝解此義者，便可發問。」
translation: The Buddha told the celestial, "If you understand this meaning, then you can ask questions."

source_sentence: 天子白佛：「不解，世尊！
translation: The prince said to the Buddha, "I don't understand, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不解，善逝！」
translation: I don't understand, good riddance!"

source_sentence: 佛復說偈言：「見等勝劣者，　　則有言論生，　三事不傾動，　　則無軟中上。」
translation: The Buddha again spoke the verse, "When you see equality of superiority and inferiority, then there's discourse that arises, and when you aren't tilted by the three things, then there's no weakness, middling, or superiority."

source_sentence: 佛告天子：「解此義者，則可發問。」
translation: The Buddha told the celestial, "If you understand this meaning, then you can ask questions."

source_sentence: 天子白佛：「不解，世尊！
translation: The prince said to the Buddha, "I don't understand, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不解，善逝！」
translation: I don't understand, good riddance!"

source_sentence: 佛復說偈言：「斷愛及名色，　　除慢無所繫，　寂滅息瞋恚，　　離結絕悕望，　不見於人天，　　此世及他世。」
translation: The Buddha then spoke another verse, "Stopping craving and name-and-form, ridding oneself of conceit and no binding, quelling anger, free of fetters and cutting off expectations, and not seeing humans and gods, this world or any other world."

source_sentence: 佛告天子：「解此義者，乃可發問。」
translation: The Buddha told the celestial, "Only someone who understands this meaning can ask questions."

source_sentence: 天子白佛：「已解，世尊！
translation: The prince said to the Buddha, "I've understood it, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 已解，善逝！」
translation: Already understood, well gone!"

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，彼天子聞佛所說，歡喜隨喜，即沒不現。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, that prince rejoiced and followed what he heard, and he simply disappeared without being seen.

source_sentence: （一〇七九）如是我聞：一時，佛在王舍城迦蘭陀竹園。
translation: (1079) Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at the Kalandaka's Bamboo Park in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時，有異比丘於後夜時至搨補河邊，脫衣置岸邊，入水洗浴。
translation: At the time, a certain monk went to the river Hypo at the end of the night, took off his robe, put it on the bank, and got into the water to bathe.

source_sentence: 浴已，還上岸，著一衣，待身乾。
translation: After bathing, he returned to the shore, put on a robe, and waited until his body was dry.

source_sentence: 時，有一天子放身光明，普照搨補河側，問比丘言：「比丘！
translation: Then, a god radiated his body in a bright light that shone universally over the side of the river Hypocrisy, and he asked the monk, "Monks!

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Bhikṣu!

source_sentence: 此是丘塚，夜則起烟，晝則火然，彼婆羅門見已而作是言：『壞此丘塚，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: 'This is a mound that smokes by night and burns by day, and when the Brāhmaṇa sees it, he says, 'Destroy this mound; dig it up, wise man; carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 又見大龜，婆羅門見已，作是言：『除此大龜，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: Seeing another large turtle, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Get rid of this large turtle, dig it up with wisdom, and carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有氍氀，婆羅門見已，作此言：『却此氍氀，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: Seeing a rug, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Get rid of this rug, using the digger's wisdom and carrying a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有肉段，彼婆羅門見已，作是言：『除此肉段，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: Seeing a piece of flesh, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Remove this piece of flesh, and the digger will know how to carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有屠殺，婆羅門見已，作是言：『壞是屠殺處，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: When he saw a butcher, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Destroy this butcher's place, and he will know how to dig it up and carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有楞耆，彼婆羅門見已，作是言：『却此楞耆，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: Seeing a lengji, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Suppress this lengji, and you will find someone who knows how to dig it up and carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有二道，彼婆羅門見已，作是言：『除此二道，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: Seeing two paths, the Brāhmaṇa saw them and said, 'Remove these two paths, digger's wisdom, and carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有門扇，婆羅門見已，作是言：『却此門扇，發掘者智，持以刀劍。』
translation: Seeing a doorway, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Remove this doorway, digger's wisdom, and carry a sword.'

source_sentence: 見有大龍，婆羅門見已，作是言：『止！
translation: Seeing a large dragon, the Brāhmaṇa saw it and said, 'Stop!'

source_sentence: 勿却大龍，應當恭敬。』
translation: Don't turn away the great dragon; be respectful.'

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 汝來受此論，往問世尊，如佛所說，汝隨受持。
translation: You came to accept this treatise and asked the Bhagavān about it, just as the Buddha had taught it, and you followed it.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 除如來，我不見世間諸天、魔、梵、沙門、婆羅門於此論心悅樂者，若諸弟子從我所聞，然後能說。」
translation: Except for the Tathāgata, I haven't seen gods, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, or priests in the world who are happy with this treatise, and if my disciples hear it from me, then they'll be able to explain it."

translation: After hearing this discourse from that celestial, the monk went to the Bhagavān, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

translation: If the great teacher acts for the śrāvakas, pities and sympathizes, and comforts them with meaning, then you should do what you've done and you should make it happen by laying grass and leaves in the open air, in a forest, in an empty house, in a mountain swamp, or in a cave, reflecting and meditating on it, not being careless, and not regretting it; this would be my teaching to follow."

source_sentence: 即說偈言：「說身為丘塚，　　覺觀夜起烟，　晝業為火然，　　婆羅門正覺。

translation: Their exertion is diligent, their intelligence is wise, and they use the sharp sword of wisdom to rid themselves of those who advance above and beyond.

source_sentence: 五蓋為巨龜，　　忿恨為氍氀，　慳愱為肉段，　　五欲屠殺處。
translation: The five hindrances are giant tortoises, anger is a rug, stinginess is a cut of meat, and the five desires are a place of slaughter.

translation: （Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Ṛṣipatana in the Deer Preserve of Bārā [Munai].

translation: At the time, the Bhagavān gathered his robe and bowl in the morning and went into the city of Pola [munai] to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，有異比丘以不住心，其心惑亂，不攝諸根，晨朝著衣持鉢，入波羅[木*奈]城乞食。
translation: Then, a certain monk, who didn't stop mind and whose mind was confused, didn't cultivate his faculties and put on his robe and bowl in the morning and went into the city of [Pāli Muktānai] to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 是比丘遙見世尊，見已，攝持諸根，端視而行。
translation: That monk saw the Bhagavān from a distance, and when he saw him, he collected his faculties and walked with dignified dignity.

source_sentence: 世尊見是比丘攝持諸根，端視而行，見已入城。
translation: The Bhagavān saw that monk gathering his faculties, gazing up, and walking, and after he saw that, he entered the city.

source_sentence: 乞食畢，還精舍，舉衣鉢，洗足已，入室坐禪。
translation: After soliciting alms, he returned to the monastery, put away his robe and bowl, washed his feet, and went into his room to sit in meditation.

source_sentence: 晡時從禪覺，入僧中，敷坐具，於大眾前坐，告諸比丘：「我今晨朝著衣持鉢，入波羅[木*奈]城乞食，見有比丘！
translation: In the afternoon, he awoke from meditation, went into the monastery, spread out his sitting cloth, and sat down in front of the crowd.

source_sentence: 以不住心、惑亂心，諸根放散，亦持衣鉢入城乞食，彼遙見我，即自斂攝竟，為是誰？」
translation: Because of their nonabiding mind and confused mind, their faculties are scattered, and they enter the city with their robe and bowl to solicit alms, and when they see me from a distance, they gather themselves in, "Who is it?"

source_sentence: 時，彼比丘從座起，整衣服，到於佛前，偏袒右肩，合掌白佛：「世尊！
translation: That monk then rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, went to the Buddha, bared his right shoulder, put his palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於晨朝入城乞食，其心惑亂，不攝諸根行，遙見世尊，即自斂心，攝持諸根。」
translation: When I entered the city in the morning to solicit alms, my mind was distracted, and I didn't tame my faculties.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 汝見我已，能自斂心，攝持諸根。
translation: After you see me, you'll be able to control your own mind and cultivate your faculties.

source_sentence: 比丘！

translation: This is how the teaching should be.

translation: If you see a monk, you should also maintain it for yourself.

source_sentence: 若復見比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，亦當如是攝持諸根，當得長夜以義饒益，安隱快樂。」
translation: If you also see a monk or nun, an upāsaka, or an upāsik, you should likewise cultivate their faculties, and they will attain long nights of benefit with meaning and peace and happiness."

translation: It was then that another monk in the crowd spoke a verse and praised him, "Because his mind is confused and he doesn't focus on mindfulness, he takes his robe and bowl in the morning and enters a town to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 中路見大師，　　威德容儀備，　欣悅生慚愧，　　即攝持諸根。」
translation: Seeing the great teacher in the middle of the road, his dignity and demeanor were so great that they were delighted and embarrassed, and they collected their faculties."
